definition: a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
aspiration/ambition/the will

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
unexpectedly/actually/to go so far as to/indeed
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
there is nothing the determined person can't accomplish (idiom)/persistence will overcome
pinyin: shi4 shang4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 世上無難事，只怕有心人

definition: lit. nothing is difficult on this earth, if your mind is set (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 天下無難事，只怕有心人

definition: If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
pinyin: zhi3 yao4 gong1 fu5 shen1 , tie3 chu3 mo2 cheng2 zhen1
related.word: 只要功夫深，鐵杵磨成針

definition: Heaven rewards the diligent. (idiom)
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
you get what you put in/you reap what you sow
pinyin: yi1 fen1 geng1 yun2 , yi1 fen1 shou1 huo4

definition: planning is with man, accomplishing with heaven (idiom); Man proposes but God disposes.
pinyin: mou2 shi4 zai4 ren2 , cheng2 shi4 zai4 tian1

definition: Failure is the mother of success.
pinyin: shi1 bai4 shi4 cheng2 gong1 zhi1 mu3

definition: one cannot achieve glory and wealth without having been through trials and tribulations (proverb)/no pain, no gain
pinyin: chi1 de2 ku3 zhong1 ku3 , fang1 wei2 ren2 shang4 ren2
related.word: 吃得苦中苦，方為人上人

definition: perseverance
lit. a thousand mile journey begins with the first step/fig. big accomplishments come from an accumulation of little achievements made one by one
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 xing2 , shi3 yu2 zu2 xia4

definition: man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
see 磨杵成針|磨杵成针[mo2 chu3 cheng2 zhen1]
lit. ninety li is merely a half of a hundred li journey (idiom)/fig. the closer one is to completing a task, the tougher it gets/a task is not done until it's done
pinyin: xing2 bai3 li3 zhe3 ban4 jiu3 shi2

definition: dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
